title: LogicInsight - Nutanix VMs Disk Inventory
description:
### üìä LogicInsight - Nutanix VMs Disk Inventory Dashboard Explanation

This **LogicInsight - Nutanix VMs Disk Inventory** dashboard provides a **detailed inventory of all virtual machine (VM) disks** within the Nutanix environment. It helps administrators **track disk allocations, sizes, and storage container assignments**, ensuring **storage management and capacity planning** are effective.

***

## **1Ô∏è‚É£ VM Disk Summary Table (Main Section)**

This **single-table view** consolidates information for **every disk assigned to VMs** in the selected clusters. It is organized by the following fields:

| Field                    | Description                                                                                                                                          |
| ------------------------ | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **CLUSTER_NAME**         | The Nutanix cluster where the VM and its disk reside.                                                                    |
| **VM_NAME**              | The name of the virtual machine the disk is assigned to. If it says "none", the disk is **unassigned or not attached** to a VM.                      |
| **DISK_ADDRESS**         | Logical identifier of the disk within the system (like a SCSI address or virtual disk number).                                                       |
| **STORAGE_CONTAINER_ID** | Unique ID of the **storage container** where the disk is located. This indicates the **logical storage space** allocated to the disk within Nutanix. |
| **DISK_SIZE**            | The **total capacity** of the disk. Examples:                                                                                                        |

-   `200 TiB` (very large disks, likely storage pools)
-   `59.629 TiB` (smaller but still significant capacity)\
    A **progress bar** visually represents disk size for quick analysis.

***

## **2Ô∏è‚É£ What You Can Do with This Dashboard**

-   ‚úÖ **Identify orphan disks**\
    Disks with **no VM association (VM_NAME = none)** may indicate **unused resources** or disks awaiting cleanup.
-   ‚úÖ **Track disk allocation by storage container**\
    Helps **ensure even distribution** of data across different storage containers for **performance optimization** and **capacity planning**.
-   ‚úÖ **Monitor disk sizes**\
    Ensure disks **match VM workload requirements**. Very large disks may need closer attention for **backup or replication strategy**.

***

## **3Ô∏è‚É£ Typical Use Cases**

-   üõ†Ô∏è **Audit and Inventory:**\
    Regularly check for disks that are **no longer in use** or improperly sized.
-   üßπ **Reclaim Unused Storage:**\
    Free up capacity by identifying and removing **orphan disks**.
-   üîÑ **Capacity Planning and Forecasting:**\
    Understand where your **storage is consumed** to predict when additional capacity will be required.

***

## **4Ô∏è‚É£ Notes and Best Practices**

-   **VM_NAME ‚Äúnone‚Äù**:\
    Review these disks periodically. They might be:

    -   Detached disks
    -   Unused clones
    -   Part of a template

-   **Disk Size vs. Storage Container**:\
    Validate whether storage containers are **balanced** or if some are **over-provisioned**.

***

### ‚úÖ Why This Dashboard Matters

This **VM Disk Inventory Dashboard** enables:

-   **Full visibility** of VM disk allocation and storage usage.
-   **Better storage governance**, ensuring resources are properly allocated and monitored.
-   **Cost optimization**, by identifying and addressing **wasted storage**.
